intro: Leucadendron natalense, commonly known as the Natal candle bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, cone-like inflorescences that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silvery hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leucadendron natalense is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
